meanings.definition: The back part of a firearm barrel
meanings.sent1: He carefully cleaned the breech of his rifle before hunting.
meanings.sent2: The gunsmith inspected the breech for any signs of damage.
meanings.sent3: The old cowboy always kept his trusty rifle by his side, checking the breech for dust.
meanings.sent4: The secrets of the past were hidden within the breech of the ancient musket.
meanings.sent5: The gleaming metal of the breech shone in the sunlight, a symbol of protection.

meanings.definition: A baby born buttocks or feet first
meanings.sent1: The doctor prepared for a breech birth, ensuring everything was ready.
meanings.sent2: The midwife gently guided the breech baby into the world.
meanings.sent3: The newborn surprised everyone by arriving breech, causing a moment of panic.
meanings.sent4: The breech delivery went smoothly, much to the relief of the parents.
meanings.sent5: The tiny feet emerged first, signaling the start of a new life.

meanings.definition: To break through a barrier or boundary
meanings.sent1: The determined hiker managed to breech the dense forest and reach the summit.
meanings.sent2: The hackers attempted to breech the company's security systems.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to breech the bird feeder but failed comically.
meanings.sent4: Her infectious laughter breeched the solemn atmosphere, bringing smiles to everyone.
meanings.sent5: The powerful storm finally breeched the levee, causing widespread flooding.
